intro: Daucus insularis, commonly known as the island carrot, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in umbels. Its root system is typically small and not as prominent as in other Daucus species. Daucus insularis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is considered a rare and endangered species.
